brief_description: To use system biology approaches to compare differences in immune responses to vaccine
brief_title: Immune Responses to Seasonal LAIV 2011-2012 Influenza Vaccination in Humans (see companion study SDY224,SDY564)
description: To use system biology approaches to compare differences in immune responses to vaccine
endpoints: Blood samples prior to vaccination and daily sampling  post vaccination up to 10 days and day 21
hypothesis: To understand and describe the mulitdimensional immune response to vaccination
objectives: Develop detailed, multi-level, multi-scale high dimensional mathematical models of  the immune response to seasonal influenza vaccination
official_title: Immune Responses to Seasonal LAIV 2011-2012 Influenza Vaccination in Humans (see companion study SDY224,SDY564)

arm.description: Subjects receiving LAIV seasonal vaccine in the 2011-2012 influenza season
arm.name: LAIV 2011

personnel.organization: University of Rochester Center for Biodefense Immune Modeling
University of Rochester Center for Biodefense Immune Modeling

program.contract_name: University of Rochester Center for Biodefense Immune Modeling II
